column2: this is the story of nat banks , an 8th generation virginian gentleman farmer living in the past , who loses his family farm , greenwood , to a pair of land speculators from washington , d . c .
the quest takes him to the mountains of north carolina , the beaches of the dominican republic , the islands off of ireland , the gardens of japan and the holy land of india .
for the past seven years mel bishop , a cold-blooded old west outlaw , had rotted away in a filthy mexican prison .

after baptizing their amnesiac boy-toy chris , the infamous pair takes him on a grand tour of their wild nightlife frolic , their spontaneous media extravaganza and their dazzling diva lifestyle in order to help him find his identity and his way home .
the corpse count ultimately overrides what little we learn along the way about vicarious redemption .
the film is an enjoyable family film -- pretty much aimed at any youngster who loves horses .
the question hanging over the time machine is not , as the main character suggests , 'what if ? ' but rather , 'how can you charge money for this ? '
first-time writer-director serry shows a remarkable gift for storytelling with this moving , effective little film .
